intro: Fleischmannia pycnocephala, commonly known as the thick-headed fleischmannia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its dense, spherical heads of yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically broad and heart-shaped, with a rough texture. Fleischmannia pycnocephala thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along stream banks.
